labels.analysis: The MCP Server, Knowledge Graph Memory Server, is designed to manage and enhance interactions with a knowledge graph. It allows users to capture, store, retrieve, and manipulate contextual information using PouchDB for data consistency and performance. The tools provided enable the creation, deletion, and management of entities, relations, and observations within the knowledge graph. This server is particularly useful for organizing and retrieving project-specific information through structured data pathways.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the server is centered around managing knowledge graph data, which aligns closely with memory management and structured data operations. The predefined category "Memory Management" was chosen as the primary label due to the server's core purpose of storing, retrieving, and organizing knowledge. "Database Operations" was selected as a secondary label since the server interacts with a database (PouchDB) and allows for querying and manipulation of data. No custom label was needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Knowledge Graph Memory Server
server_info_crawled.author: @bneil/mcp-memory-pouchdb
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage and enhance your interactions with a robust knowledge graph. Capture, store, and retrieve contextual information seamlessly using PouchDB for improved data consistency and performance. Organize your memory data by project-specific paths for better management and retrieval.

tools.name: get_current_time
tools.description: Deploy Server Knowledge Graph Memory Server @bneil/mcp-memory-pouchdb Try in Playground get_current_time

tools.name: create_entities
tools.description: Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph

tools.name: create_relations
tools.description: Create multiple new relations between entities in the knowledge graph. Relations should be in active voice

tools.name: add_observations
tools.description: Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph

tools.name: delete_entities
tools.description: Delete multiple entities and their associated relations from the knowledge graph

tools.name: delete_observations
tools.description: Delete specific observations from entities in the knowledge graph

tools.name: delete_relations
tools.description: Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph

tools.name: search_nodes
tools.description: Search for nodes in the knowledge graph based on a query

tools.name: open_nodes
tools.description: Open specific nodes in the knowledge graph by their names

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "disableMemoryFile": false
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@bneil/mcp-memory-pouchdb/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
